vine.game

Interface ITransform

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Transform

    public interface ITransform

    Transform

    Describes a transformation of location(rotation + position) in a two dimensional room (world).

    Properties

    A Transform can have one parent transformation and multiple child transformations.

    If there is a parent transform, then the described transformation is relative to the transformation described by the parent. If the parent is null, then the transform describes a transformation in worldspace.

    Units

    The unit for rotation is always Degrees (0 degrees rotation means a line parallel to the x-Axis). The unit for translation is the used world-unit.

    Author:
    Steffen Kromm, first created on 03.05.2016

    • Method Detail

      • getParent

        ITransform getParent()
        The transformation that is used to describe the relative transformation of this transform to the world. (this.worldToLocal = parent.worldToLocal this.transformation); It's guaranteed that this transform is a child transform of the parent transform.
        Returns:
        The parent transform.

      • getChildren

        java.lang.Iterable<ITransform> getChildren()
        Returns all children of this transform. It's guaranteed that the parent of each of the children transform is this transform.
        Returns:
        The child transforms of this transform.

      • addChild

        boolean addChild(ITransform transform)
        Adds the transform to the child transforms of this object.
        Parameters:
        transform - The transform, that should be added as a child.
        Returns:
        True, if the transform was successfully added as a child.

      • setParent

        boolean setParent(ITransform transform)
        Sets the parent of this transformation.
        Parameters:
        transform - The new parent transformation. A valid parent transform must not be a transform of the children transformation graphs(child, child of child and so on) or this transform.
        Returns:
        True, if the parent could be successfully set.

      • getLocalToWorld

        vine.math.matrix.Mat3f getLocalToWorld()
        Returns:
        The local to world transformation matrix.

      • getWorldToLocal

        vine.math.matrix.Mat3f getWorldToLocal()
        Returns:
        The world to local transformation matrix.

      • getLocalPosition

        vine.math.vector.Vec2f getLocalPosition()
        Returns:
        The position of this transform relative to its parent.

      • getWorldPosition

        vine.math.vector.Vec2f getWorldPosition()
        Returns:
        The position of this transform relative to the world.

      • getLocalRotation

        float getLocalRotation()
        Returns:
        The rotation of this transform in degree relative to its parent.

      • getWorldRotation

        float getWorldRotation()
        Returns:
        The rotation of this transform in degree relative to the world.

      • translate

        void translate(float x,
               float y)
        Translates the transform by the by x and y defined direction.
        Parameters:
        x - The translation in x dimension.
        y - The translation in y dimension.

      • rotate

        void rotate(float degrees)
        Rotates the transform by the given angle in degrees.
        Parameters:
        radians - Angle of rotation in degree.
